intro: Sphenomeris deltoidea, commonly known as the delta leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its deltoid-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It is often found in coastal areas and can thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Sphenomeris deltoidea is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its medicinal properties are not well-documented.
